alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 5:13PM EDT until July 18 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN WHITLEY, CENTRAL BELL AND SOUTH CENTRAL KNOX COUNTIES... At 513 PM EDT, Weather radar indicated light to moderate rain continuing across much of the warned area. Afternoon rainfall totals in some locations are likely near 4 inches. Minor flooding has been reported, and there is a potential that more significant flash flooding is occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by showers and thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Pineville, Ingram, Davisburg, Clear Creek Springs, Wheeler, Kayjay, Fourmile, Wallsend, Chenoa, Ferndale, Wasioto, East Pineville, Straight Creek, Ponza, Cary, Goins, Frakes, Calvin, Arjay and Blanche. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
